question: To DoctorI was diagnosed with pulmonary Tuberculosis in september 2009 after examination of the pleural fluid. the ADA level was 56.  After that I have taken treatment for 6 months 4D Plus for 2 months and remaining medicines for next 4 months. After completion of the treatment I had met my doctor with blood test and X-Ray report. After seeing the reports my doctor informed that the treatment is completed and I need not continue with the medicine.However Again in September this year I started getting pain on my right side, followed by fever & weakness.After series of X-Ray, CT Scan and USG I have once again been diagnosed with pulomnary tuberculosis.  This time the pleural fluid showed ADA level of 124.  I consulted in a big hospital and now I am taking R-Cinex 600 mg, Levofloxin 750 mg, Pyzina 750 mg, combutal 800 mg  &  Benadon.  The doctor has advised treatment for 9 months to one year.I am also taking treatment for Diabetes as my doctor told me controls of diabetes is important during treatment of tuberculosis.Doctor please let me know how the Tuberculosis has relapsed within 6 months and I am on the right course of treatment. Are the medicines that I am taking are proper.  I am having occasional cough but even after taking medicine for 3 weeks the cough is not stopping.I would be very greatful if you can clear my doubtsBhanuprakashAge 46 years
title: Pulmonary Tuberculosis
